title: Afternoon showers expected in several areas
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (14).

title: Bus accident on Ampara–Mahiyanganaya road
byline: A luxury passenger transport bus veered off the road in the early hours of this morning (14) in the Wewatta area along the Ampara–Mahiyanganaya main road.

title: Police step up night inspections on long-distance buses amid rising accidents
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has directed all Officers-in-Charge (OIC) and senior police officers to conduct special inspections on long-distance passenger buses, in response to a surge in accidents involving such vehicles.

title: Trump says US to lift Syria sanctions, secures $600 billion Saudi deal
byline: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to the Gulf on Tuesday with a surprise announcement that the United States will lift long-standing sanctions on Syria, and a $600 billion commitment from Saudi Arabia to invest in the U.S.

title: 70% of deaths in Sri Lanka caused by high blood pressure – Health officials
byline: The Non-Communicable Disease Unit (NCD) of the Ministry of Health has revealed that high blood pressure is responsible for 70% of total deaths in Sri Lanka.

title: Dolphins wash ashore in Kalutara
byline: Six dolphins have washed ashore on the Kalutara South beach, raising concerns among wildlife officials and marine conservationists.

title: Sri Lanka emerges as South Asia’s top destination in 2025 with strategic tourism growth and rising earnings: Report
byline: Industry analysts observing Sri Lanka’s tourism performance in early May 2025 suggested that the island nation was experiencing a robust recovery, further solidifying its position as a preferred destination in South Asia.

title: Uruguay’s José Mujica, world’s ‘poorest president’, dies
byline: Former Uruguayan President José Mujica, known as “Pepe”, has died at the age of 89.

title: Gold prices drop in Sri Lanka
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have decreased by approximately Rs. 6,000, according to the latest market data from the Colombo Gold Centre.

title: Court grants leave for petition to disqualify Ramanathan Archchuna as MP
byline: The Court of Appeal has fixed for hearing a case filed seeking to disqualify Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna from holding a parliamentary seat.

title: Bakery worker found dead under suspicious circumstances
byline: A worker at a bakery in the Waskaduwa area of Kalutara North has been found dead under suspicious circumstances near a staircase in the bakery.

title: Litro’s manpower workers launch strike over wage dispute
byline: Nearly 250 manpower workers at the Litro Gas Terminal in Muthurajawela have launched a strike, demanding fair wages and long-overdue salary revisions.

title: Gary Anandasangaree appointed Canada’s Public Safety Minister
byline: Sri Lankan-born Gary Anandasangaree has been sworn in as Canada’s new Minister of Public Safety in Prime Minister Mark Carney’s recently unveiled cabinet.

title: Govt. releases compensation for Kotmale bus accident victims
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the release of compensation from the President’s Fund for the families of those who lost their lives in the recent tragic bus accident in the Gerandi Ella area of Kotmale.

title: Trump meets Syrian president, says he is looking into normalising ties
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump met with Syria’s president in Saudi Arabia on Wednesday, after a surprise U.S. announcement it would lift all sanctions on the Islamist-led government, and said Washington was exploring the possibility of normalising ties with Damascus.

title: Spike in dengue and chikungunya cases in Sri Lanka
byline: A total of 19,901 dengue cases have been reported in the country so far this year, according to the National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU).

title: Mahindananda files anticipatory bail petition over bribery case
byline: Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage has filed a petition before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (May 14), seeking anticipatory bail against his possible arrest by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).
